Name: Automatic Sprinkler Requirements
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to automatic sprinkler requirements for hotels, motels, lodging houses and rooming houses.
RTF:
{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}}

\v0\par
\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows\ulnone :\par
\par
\tab Section 1.   Subdivision a of section 27-353.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is REPEALED and subdivision b and c of such section are relettered to be subdivision a and b.\par
\tab\'a72.\tab The heading of section 27-353.1 of such code is amended to read as follows:\par
\tab\'a727-353.1  Smoke protection for [elevators and] escalators.\par
\tab\'a73.\tab Subdivision w of section 27-954 of such code is amended to read as follows:\par
\tab (w)\tab In all existing buildings classified in occupancy group J-1 [(except for "residential hotels," as such term is defined by the commissioner pursuant to rules and regulations) all]:\par
\tab (1)\tab All spaces listed in subdivisions (c), (d), (l), (m), (n), (o), (p) and (q), [,] of this section, except that an approved smoke detection alarm system may be installed in those locations described under subdivisions (o) and (q) in lieu of sprinklers.  Such smoke detection system shall be of the supervisory type connected to an approval central station; and\par
\tab (2)\tab All corridors, public areas, storage closets and spaces in occupancy groups C and F; or all sleeping rooms, storage closets and spaces in occupancy groups C and F;\par
\tab (3)\tab Sprinklers required by paragraph (2) of this subdivision may be omitted at every floor above the main entrance floor where all elevators open only into elevator vestibules that have been completed on or before April first, nineteen hundred eighty-seven;\par
\tab (4)\tab Notwithstanding paragraph (2) of this subdivision, storage closets with an area of less than seventy-five square feet may be provided with smoke detectors of the central supervisory type connected to an approved central station;\par
\tab (5)\tab Notwithstanding any other provision of this code, the sprinklers serving the storage closets may be connected with the domestic water supply;\par
\tab (6)\tab Notwithstanding paragraph (2) of this subdivision, in all existing buildings classified in occupancy group J-1, a system of automatic sprinklers shall be required throughout all areas of such buildings;\par
\tab (7)\tab (A)\tab Buildings and spaces subject to the requirements of paragraph (2) of this subdivision shall be in compliance therewith on or before December thirty-first, nineteen hundred eighty-nine;\par
\tab\tab (B)\tab Buildings subject to the requirements of paragraph (6) of this subdivision shall be in compliance therewith on or before December thirty-first, nineteen hundred eight-nine;\par
\tab (8)\tab Notwithstanding paragraphs (6) and (7) of this subdivision, where compliance with the time requirements set forth in such paragraphs would cause undue hardship, the commissioner, with the approval of the fire commissioner, may extend the time of compliance.  Before an application for such a time extension shall be considered, all required applications and plans shall be filed and approved, permits obtained and a good faith effort towards completion of the work shall have been made.\par
\tab\'a74.\tab Such section of such code is amended by adding a new subdivision (a) to read as follows:\par
\tab (a)\tab Sprinklers for escalators, where required by article five of subchapter five of this code.\par
\tab\'a75.\tab This local law shall take effect immediately, except as otherwise specifically provided herein.\par
\par
